item.title: Interface Command
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Yea. interface command is jumpy, well not really. I don’t think interfaces are in order, because you can have IE 13500 working [dunno if it does] and 13499 might not.
That would be why, if you’re trying random numbers most likely :D, try a known working one. IE 12468
So I’m PRETTY sure the ones that d/c you are ones that are words in diff places, like the words in Report Abuse. Or quest list, etc etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface Command
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

I have an interface command in my source where when you type in ::interface # it shows the interface that you just specified, but instead it disconnects me everytime. I get no errors in runserver, I just disconnect. Anyone know the problem?

}else if (command.startsWith("interface")) { try { int id = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(10)); println_debug("Interface: "+id); showInterface(id); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::interface #"); }

Read full topic
